TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When your watching KSP videos and you try to rotate the camera or go to map view
When you can watch your satellite do mapsat or kethane scanning for an hour and it seems like two minutes.
When you refuse to play space games because they "aren't accurate."
Wasn't expecting this one when I woke up this morning, but... When you have a dream that involves ground texture clipping...
When your first thought when looking at a lampshade, is that could be an engine bell...
has happened to me countless times, usually at work

When you wake up in the morning and in this half asleep state after waking up, you are really really, worried that you won't be able to solve this building problem you we're having before calling it a night.

Seriously I tend to spend a lot of time in the VAB before going to sleep, and I wake up waaay too often way too worried about a problem I had the night before.
star trek: first contact

When you find online a game called "sinking simulator" and, after five minutes, manage to lunch submarines in space.

Yes, i did it.

I may need some help.

when you find online a game called "sinking simulator" and, after five minutes, manage to lunch submarines in space.

lET'S RAISE THAT BUOYANCY FACTOR NOW SHALL WE.
When you realize that you can make underwater probes and submarines with the stock part module system.

When I merge into traffic, I treat it like I'm docking with the car in front of me.

If I accidentally "dock" and the car in front of me gets damaged, I tell the other driver he needed more struts. [/joke]

I do tell people to add struts to something if it doesn't work right. They always look at me funny.
When your alarm goes off in the morning, you look at the clock and you're like "it's not time to fire my engines yet!"

When you get fired from Star Bucks because you said "The coffee maker didn't break into pieces, it was rapidly dissembled because of lithobreaking."

Or is that just me.

When you see this on Facebook:

And your brain immediately breaks it down into its kerbaly components before even recognising it as Curiosity.

When you watch Smokey and the Bandit the night before, read a post on the Steam forum where someone says if they don't play KSP less their life may turn into a country song and your brain immediately spits out:

Eve bound and down, loaded up space-truckin'.

We're gonna do what they say can't be done!

We've got a long way to go and a short time to get there

We're Eve bound, just watch them Kerbals run!

Keep your boosters on full power, no need to aerobrake!

Let it all hang cause we've got a run to make.

Kerbals are thirstin' out on Duna and there's beer somewhere on Eve,

And we'll bring some back matter what it takes!

Eve bound and down, loaded up space-truckin'.

We're gonna do what they say can't be done!

We've got a long way to go and a short time to get there

We're Eve bound, just watch them Kerbals run!

.. before you can stop your fingers from typing. Then you remember this thread and repost it here, I should probably be ashamed of myself .
When you want to name your cat Deltavee.

If you see something like this:

On a highway and you instinctively think: How the heck does that thing dock without RCS?
When you spend more money than you can really spare on air-cooling equipment to keep your gaming rig going in a heatwave.
Walking up a steep hill, you think "Man, my TWR is to low. I need to shed some outer stages."

You're behind a row of cars. You have the urge to hit "[" then Esc and End Flight to get rid of them.

When you build that nice car, hop in and then yell "god dangit! I forgot to install MechJeb!"

When you're in your car and "I wonder how fast I'll go if I strap an aerospike engine on the back, like my Speed Rover".

Edited July 18, 2013 by Benie

well i was talking to some class mates and i saw the mun and i was like i have been there

Edit* sorry was meant to be moon

Walking up a steep hill, you think "Man, my TWR is to low. I need to shed some outer stages."

You mean clothes?
When you're watching a YouTube video and you keep catching yourself trying to adjust the camera for a better angle.

When it's 4am right now... opps. Time to sleep.

Edited July 25, 2013 by Tw1
